title: Productivity of AI use in software coding not equal among users
content: AI usage is highest among less experienced programmers, but productivity gains go to seasoned developers.

title: Critical Atlantic Ocean currents kept going during last ice age
content: During the last ice age, the Atlantic Ocean’s powerful current system remained active and continued to transport warm, salty water from the tropics to the North Atlantic despite extensive ice cover across much of the Northern Hemisphere, finds new research led by UCL scientists.

title: Global warming and CO2 emissions 56 million years ago resulted in massive forest fires and soil erosion
content: The climate warmed up almost as quickly 56 million years ago as it is doing now. When a huge amount of CO2 entered the atmosphere in a short period of time, it led to large-scale forest fires and erosion.

title: Alle Scholen Verzamelen is now open for group 6, 7 and 8
content: On 22 May, groups 6, 7 and 8 from primary schools across the Netherlands will once again collect data, thereby contributing to scientific research conducted by Wageningen University & Research and Utrecht University!

title: A succesful energy transition calls for a different approach to citizen engagement
content: In her PhD thesis, Irene Bronsvoort argues that the problem does not lie with citizens who are unwilling to participate, but rather with the way encounters between residents and governments are organised.

title: Why sustainable fashion isn’t taking off: Two new studies point to misaligned marketing tactics
content: Two new studies by researchers show that retailers promoting sustainable and second-hand fashion may be unintentionally missing potential customers simply because of their marketing tactics.

title: New Master’s course explores how nature can help solve sustainability challenges
content: Students of sustainability-related Master’s at the Graduate School of Geosciences can now follow the course Nature-positive Futures: Understanding and working with Nature-Based Solutions for Ecosystem Services.

title: “The absence of conflict is not necessarily cooperation”
content: Susanne Schmeier, professor of Water Cooperation, Law and Diplomacy, will hold her inaugural lecture on 3 December. We interviewed her about her work.

title: Grant for research into a sustainable chemical industry
content: Matteo Gazzani gets on with research project CO2URAGE for making industry more sustainable.

title: [urban interfaces] seminar 2025-2026: The Risky City
content: The research group [urban interfaces] presents a new edition of their annual RMeS RMA/PhD seminar series: The Risky City.

title: Removing CO₂ from the atmosphere? The promises of marine Carbon Dioxide Removal
content: What is the potential of marine Carbone Dioxide Removal (mCDR) to help achieve climate targets?

title: In memoriam Egbert Tellegen (1937-2025)
content: With Egbert’s passing away, we lose an unconventional, honest icon of both the Dutch environmental movement and environmental education in the Netherlands.

title: Climate obstruction calls for an entrepreneurial, transformative government
content: Innovation scholar Joeri Wesseling's suggestions to counter climate obstruction.

title: Global environmental treaties are paralysed — a Nature commentary calls for reform
content: A new comment in Nature identifies a pattern in international treaties, which the authors call “institutional paralysis”: many meetings and decisions, but very little real-world impact.

title: Huge NWO grant to build the world’s largest research cluster for real-time energy system studies
content: Project led by TU Delft receives huge grant from NWO to build world's largest research digital twins for energy systems
